task.title: Polar Tracking
task.shortdesc: When polar tracking is turned on, guides display on the screen automatically at the polar angle increment

context.p: that you specify. For example, if you draw a line with polar tracking turned on with angle increment set as 65 degrees, the rubber-banding line displays at 65-degree increments.
Polar tracking and orthogonal locking cannot be used at the same time-turning one option on turns the other option off.
To enable polar tracking and specify the polar angle increment

step.cmd: Choose Tools > Drafting Settings from the main menu.

info.p: On the Object Snap toolbar, click the Object Snap Settings button. Type DSETTINGS on the command line andthen press Enter.

step.cmd: Switch to the Polar Tracking tab.

result.p: To specify the polar angle increments:

ol.li: Select an angle from the Increment Angle drop-downlist.
Mark the Additional Angles checkbox and click New to define a custom angle increment.

result.p: TIP To toggle polar tracking on and off at any time, click the Polar Tracking button on the status bar or press F10.
To draw objects using polar tracking

ol.li: Turn on polar tracking and start a drawing command, suchas ARC, CIRCLE, or LINE. You can also use polar tracking with editing commands, suchas COPY and MOVE.

As you move your cursor to specify points, notice the dotted polar tracking line that appears at the tracking angles you specified. Points you specify while the line is displayed conform to the polar tracking angle.
